chapter.title: Search history
chapter.para: The History link at the top right of the screen displays the search history made in the management interface in an iframe (a screen block).

sect1.title: Displaying the search history
sect1.para: The history shows the searches undertaken by the user in reverse chronological order. The latest searches are displayed on top.

figure.title: Search history display to the left of the screen

sect1.para: You can print the search results with the "Print" icon.
All the search results can be placed directly into a basket.
All the search results can also be sent by e-mail.

sect1.title: Memorizing the search history
sect1.para: The search history is memorized in the user session. You will be able to retrieve this history subsequently after a disconnection, or after logging out from your computer and connecting anew on another computer.

sect1.title: Clearing the search history
sect1.para: The icon Clear history deletes the search history entirely.

The icon Clear checked searches enables selective cleanups. To clear one or more searches, check the box at the beginning of the line. Repeat the operation for all the searches you wish to delete. Finally click on the icon Clear checked searches.

sect1.title: Saving the search history
sect1.para: The icon "Save history" saves the current search history. Warning, this does not correspond to exporting a history file. For more information on search history import/export, consult the section

sect1.title: Search history Import/Export
sect1.para: A search history can be exported into a file. Conversely this file can be re-imported into PMB.
This operation is carried out with the icons export and import located at the top of the window search history.

figure.title: The "Export" icon (the data is copied from the list into the storage disk)
The "import" icon (the data is copied from the storage disk into the list)

sect1.para: The search history is exported into a file search.rsh. You can save this file if it corresponds to searches you wish to keep.
Should you need these search results later, you will have at your disposal a ready-made file.
